channel.title: Quiet time notes
channel.description: Recent content on Quiet time notes

item.title: JER 13
item.description: JER 13:20 The leaders of Israel was given to lead Israel in the ways of God but instead they spearheaded rebellion, shedding of blood and idolatry and at some point, God had to take them on an exile trip for 70 years Related verses: Jeremiah 13:20. See notes

item.title: JER 12
item.description: JER 12:16 God is impartial to anyone. He will bless either the he or the gentile as long as they have faith in him Related verses: Jeremiah 12:16. See notes

item.title: You Are Holy
item.description: you are holy you are worthy kings of kings lord of lords I worship you I honor you I adore you are holy, holy you are worthy oh worthy I worship I honor you

item.title: Ever So Loving
item.description: ever so loving ever forgiving ever so wise ever merciful how merciful how glorious the most loving how merciful full of grace full of wonder the almighty ever merciful saviour deliverer the almighty full of grace

item.title: JER 19
item.description: JER 19:5 The valley of Ben Hinnom was used to burn innocent children as sacrifices to Baal. God told Abraham to sacrifice his son as well on one of the mountains of Moriah long ago. I think it wouldn’t have been more difficult for Abraham if he had many children but because it was the only son of his old age, it was more difficult to do Related verses: Genesis 22:2, Genesis 22:6, Jeremiah 19:5.

item.title: JER 45
item.description: JER 45:5 God was going to destroy Jerusalem soon through Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and God was saving Baruch the stress of acquiring things that would soon be destroyed. Because Baruch had been a faithful friend and scribe for Jeremiah, God was repaying him his good deeds by sparing his life. It pays to be good. Related verses: Jeremiah 45:5. See notes

item.title: JER 36
item.description: JER 36:23 No fear for God. Related verses: Jeremiah 36:23. See notes JER 36:7 God was the one initiating repentance for his people yet they would not listen Related verses: Jeremiah 36:7. See notes

item.title: JER 25
item.description: JER 25:3 Jeremiah preached for 23 years warning of the impending doom and how they should repent but they didn’t. God is righteous and if he would not forgive, then it was just of him Related verses: Jeremiah 25:3. See notes JER 25:11 This is where Daniel got his revelation about when they would be free from exile (70 years) When there is the shedding of innocent blood and idolatry, judgement is soon to come.

item.title: 2CH 36
item.description: 2CH 36:21 This is where Daniel got his revelation about when they would be free from exile (70 years) When there is the shedding of innocent blood and idolatry, judgement is soon to come. Related verses: Leviticus 26:34, 2 Chronicles 36:21, Jeremiah 25:11, Daniel 9:2. See notes

item.title: DAN 9
item.description: DAN 9:2 This is where Daniel got his revelation about when they would be free from exile (70 years) When there is the shedding of innocent blood and idolatry, judgement is soon to come. Related verses: Leviticus 26:34, 2 Chronicles 36:21, Jeremiah 25:11, Daniel 9:2. See notes

item.title: JER 26
item.description: JER 26:11 Just like it was done to Jesus when they wanted to kill him and they accused him that he wanted to destroy the temple Related verses: Jeremiah 26:11, Matthew 26:66. See notes JER 26:3 Ever merciful and always ready to give time for repentance for he is not willing to destroy us but the ruler of the earth has to exercise justice and judgement Related verses: Jeremiah 26:3. See notes

item.title: JER 22
item.description: JER 22:10 This is tough punishment due to repetitive disobedience and an unwillingness to repent because of the pleasures that serving idols give. Anyone that looks for prosperity at the expense of God is bound to be in darkness. Related verses: Jeremiah 22:10. See notes JER 22:9 Idolatry leads to a curse. Brings a person into a curse,leads to direct disobedience to God and the resultant effect is judgement Related verses: Jeremiah 22:8-9.

item.title: JER 47
item.description: JER 47:4 The Philistines were originally from Caphtor in Crete. The same place that is now modern day Palestine Related verses: Jeremiah 47:4. See notes

item.title: 2CH 35
item.description: 2CH 35:22 This were the words of an unbeliever. I need to pay attention to the words of people because God could also be behind it. Pharaoh Neco wanted to help the King of Assyria to fight against Nabopolassar the king of Babylon but Josiah would not listen to the warning and lost his life in the process Related verses: 2 Chronicles 35:22. See notes 2CH 35:3 One of the duties of the priests and Levites apart from helping in the temple service was to teach the nation of the laws of God.

item.title: 1CO 8
item.description: 1CO 8:12 This is very deep. I’ve really learnt something today. It has never been about food but love and liberty Related verses: 1 Corinthians 8:12. See notes

item.title: GEN 2
item.description: GEN 2:16 The progression from Genesis 2 where God created man and animals and instructed them to eat plants until their fall. After the flood, some plants would have taken time to develop but God now accepted me San to eat of any and every animal not mentioning clean or unclean until the time of Moses. How did Noah know the clean and unclean animals to pick because we only found out about it in exodus but Abraham had already been sacrificing clean animals even in the time of Abel they probably knew what was clean and unclean.

item.title: GEN 7
item.description: GEN 7:2 The progression from Genesis 2 where God created man and animals and instructed them to eat plants until their fall. After the flood, some plants would have taken time to develop but God now accepted me San to eat of any and every animal not mentioning clean or unclean until the time of Moses. How did Noah know the clean and unclean animals to pick because we only found out about it in exodus but Abraham had already been sacrificing clean animals even in the time of Abel they probably knew what was clean and unclean.

item.title: GEN 9
item.description: GEN 9:3 The progression from Genesis 2 where God created man and animals and instructed them to eat plants until their fall. After the flood, some plants would have taken time to develop but God now accepted me San to eat of any and every animal not mentioning clean or unclean until the time of Moses. How did Noah know the clean and unclean animals to pick because we only found out about it in exodus but Abraham had already been sacrificing clean animals even in the time of Abel they probably knew what was clean and unclean.

item.title: LEV 11
item.description: LEV 11:3 The progression from Genesis 2 where God created man and animals and instructed them to eat plants until their fall. After the flood, some plants would have taken time to develop but God now accepted me San to eat of any and every animal not mentioning clean or unclean until the time of Moses. How did Noah know the clean and unclean animals to pick because we only found out about it in exodus but Abraham had already been sacrificing clean animals even in the time of Abel they probably knew what was clean and unclean.

item.title: JER 3
item.description: JER 3:15 The shepherds are the priests whose role is to teach the people the ways of God because Israel and Judah had backslidden to the point where the covenant curses began to operate in the nation. Israel was taken into captivity by Assyria in 722 BC and after 136 years, Babylon destroyed Judah Related verses: Jeremiah 3:15. See notes

item.title: REV 6
item.description: REV 6:6 War, natural disasters and famine are signs and instruments of God’s judgement. When Jesus breaks open the seal, they will begin to manifest and we can already see Related verses: Mark 13:8, Revelation 6:1-8. See notes

item.title: REV 20
item.description: REV 20:12 There is no reproduction in heaven. Angels don’t marry. When they rise from the dead? We know that not everyone has risen from the dead except for Jesus because everyone else who was raised from the dead died again. We are still awaiting our ressurected body. This means that all dead people are still somewhere but not in heaven. Probably Hades but in the part of paradise awaiting ressurection.

item.title: ACT 11
item.description: ACT 11:26 They met in the the church. A physical place Related verses: Acts 11:26. See notes

item.title: ISA 65
item.description: ISA 65:20 It’s meant to be a minimum of 100 years old. Anything short of that will be thought of as a curse according to the scriptures here Related verses: Isaiah 65:20. See notes ISA 65:2 Following are the thought and intention of my heart can be dangerous if it doesn’t align with the word and will if God. This is the reason everything I do and think of must be subjected to the word of God.

item.title: MRK 9
item.description: MRK 9:7 The testimony of the father was confirmed in the Jordan River where Jacob wrestled with an angel after he crossed it and received a blessing. The Jordan was also where Jesus received the anointing after being baptized. The Jordan was also where Elisha had received the double portion of the anointing when they divided it and crossed on foot. The father also testified on the mountain. John the Baptist the first witness, the three disciples (Peter, James and John), the second witness.

item.title: ISA 63
item.description: ISA 63:5 Everyone has gone their own way and no I’ve was listening to the prophets warning. There was so much idolatry and bloodshed a new the time of judgement was at hand. Related verses: Isaiah 63:5. See notes ISA 63:1 Crimson-stained garment, symbolic of blood and symbolic of victory over the enemy. Related verses: Isaiah 63:1. See notes

item.title: ISA 62
item.description: ISA 62:7 We can continue to call on God such that he is forced to give a response Related verses: Isaiah 62:7, Luke 18:1-9. See notes

item.title: LUK 18
item.description: LUK 18:1 We can continue to call on God such that he is forced to give a response Related verses: Isaiah 62:7, Luke 18:1-9. See notes LUK 18:8 Persistence is directly related to how quick I receive your answers. Persistent prayer is directly proportional to how much faith I have Related verses: LUKE 18:8. See notes

item.title: ISA 60
item.description: ISA 60:22 The nation Israel began with two old couples and the wife was barren but it became a nation through which salvation came. It will get be more glorious in the future especially in the second coming of Jesus. Related verses: Isaiah 60:22. See notes ISA 60:6 Prophecy to what finally happened when Jesus was born. Wise men from the east brought Gold, Frankincense and myrrh Related verses: 1 Kings 10:2, Isaiah 60:6, Matthew 2:1.

item.title: 1KI 10
item.description: 1KI 10:2 Prophecy to what finally happened when Jesus was born. Wise men from the east brought Gold, Frankincense and myrrh Related verses: 1 Kings 10:2, Isaiah 60:6, Matthew 2:1. See notes 1KI 10:10 Gold, frankincense and myrrh were gifts given to kings. it was worthy of Jesus to receive those gifts because he was the king of kings Related verses: 1 Kings 10:10, Matthew 2:11. See notes 1KI 10:28 Kue, known as Cilicia in new testament times was the home province of Apostle Paul

item.title: MAT 2
item.description: MAT 2:1 Prophecy to what finally happened when Jesus was born. Wise men from the east brought Gold, Frankincense and myrrh Related verses: 1 Kings 10:2, Isaiah 60:6, Matthew 2:1. See notes MAT 2:11 Gold, frankincense and myrrh were gifts given to kings. it was worthy of Jesus to receive those gifts because he was the king of kings Related verses: 1 Kings 10:10, Matthew 2:11. See notes MAT 2:3 Herod the king and Jerusalem were disturbed at the announcement of the birth of a king whereas the wise men were joyous to know about a great king being born.

item.title: EPH 6
item.description: EPH 6:15 The Lord’s armour Vs the believer’s armour Related verses: Isaiah 59:17, Ephesians 6:14-15. See notes EPH 6:11 On a sidenote: “We dishonour God by breaking the law” - Romans 3:23 The full armour of God is enough to protect us from the devil’s attack. Belt of truth breastplate of righteousness shoes of the gospel of peace shield of faith - quench ALL fiery darts helmet of salvation sword of the spirit - word of God pray in the spirit The devil’s weapon is deception.

item.title: ISA 59
item.description: ISA 59:17 The Lord’s armour Vs the believer’s armour Related verses: Isaiah 59:17, Ephesians 6:14-15. See notes

item.title: ISA 58
item.description: ISA 58:5 Fasting is a means of humbling myself. It should also be a time to mourn for my sins and produce a repentant heart (poor in Spirit) It looks like this fasting was done on the Sabbath because it was the only day that God did not permit work. Fasting makes my voice heard. Fasting is not just about depriving the body of food even though it’s a means of starving the flesh to stuff the Spirit.

item.title: MRK 8
item.description: MRK 8:26 The man whose sight was restored was not from the village in Bethsaida. Unbelief was high in Bethsaida and Jesus denounced the city for their unbelief Related verses: Mark 8:26. See notes MRK 8:37 The life of man is too costly that the penalty was death. Only God is the author of life and only he has the right to take it. Related verses: Psalms 49:8, Mark 8:35-37. See notes

item.title: EXO 5
item.description: EXO 5:1 Jesus fed them until they were satisfied. Everyone ate and the disciples had full baskets left for themselves. When we follow Jesus he provides for our needs. He is our great shepherd so we will not lack any good thing. Related verses: Exodus 5:1, Psalms 23:1, Mark 6:42. See notes

item.title: MRK 6
item.description: MRK 6:42 Jesus fed them until they were satisfied. Everyone ate and the disciples had full baskets left for themselves. When we follow Jesus he provides for our needs. He is our great shepherd so we will not lack any good thing. Related verses: Exodus 5:1, Psalms 23:1, Mark 6:42. See notes MRK 6:31 Jesus fed the people and also ensured that the disciples also had food to eat. Man shall not live by bread ALONE but man still needs blood

item.title: PSA 23
item.description: PSA 23:1 Jesus fed them until they were satisfied. Everyone ate and the disciples had full baskets left for themselves. When we follow Jesus he provides for our needs. He is our great shepherd so we will not lack any good thing. Related verses: Exodus 5:1, Psalms 23:1, Mark 6:42. See notes PSA 23:6 What happens when the Lord is my shepherd, goodness, mercy and unfailing love will follow me. I won’t have to chase it.

item.title: GEN 1
item.description: GEN 1:28 The blessings of the Lord makes rich. It always increase Related verses: Genesis 1:28, Proverbs 10:22, Isaiah 51:2. See notes GEN 1:30 Before the fall of man, the food given to mankind was every green plant and fruit-bearing tree with SEED in it. This islso brings to mind the notion of fruitfulness. After the fall of man, eating animals was included but blood was forbidden. Related verses: GENESIS 1:29-30.

item.title: ISA 51
item.description: ISA 51:2 The blessings of the Lord makes rich. It always increase Related verses: Genesis 1:28, Proverbs 10:22, Isaiah 51:2. See notes

item.title: PRO 10
item.description: PRO 10:22 The blessings of the Lord makes rich. It always increase Related verses: Genesis 1:28, Proverbs 10:22, Isaiah 51:2. See notes PRO 10:22 the blessings of God makes rich and there is no sorrow attached Related verses: Proverbs 10:22, Ecclesiastes 5:19. See notes PRO 10:29 Defence or ruin? it depends on me to choose the way of God or not Related verses: Proverbs 10:29. See notes PRO 10:26 very irritating

item.title: ISA 50
item.description: ISA 50:1 We go into slavery because of sins, injustice and wickedness and away from God’s presence because of transgression (breaking God’s law) Related verses: Isaiah 50:1. See notes ISA 50:5 Suffering of the messiah prophesied long ago by Isaiah the Prophet. Jesus had the tongue of disciples that’s why people were amazed at his teaching and his words could comfort people. Related verses: Isaiah 50:4-7, Matthew 26:67-68. See notes

item.title: ISA 45
item.description: ISA 45:7 God created darkness and disaster but forms light and peace Related verses: Isaiah 45:7. See notes

item.title: MRK 5
item.description: MRK 5:18 Jesus did not let the gentle man to be his disciple because Jesus only came for the Jews. And the Holy Spirit was to be poured out on Jews first before the gentiles Related verses: Mark 5:18. See notes MRK 5:20 None of Jesus disciples were gentiles. The demoniac wanted to join Jesus but Jesus forbid him and instead commissioned him to preach in the 10 gentile cities of Decapolis.

item.title: ISA 43
item.description: ISA 43:2 Israel passed through the waters if the red sea and Shadrach, Meshach and Abednego was put in the flames of Babylon Related verses: Isaiah 43:2. See notes

item.title: ISA 42
item.description: ISA 42:1 Moses was the deliverer from Egypt, Cyrus was the deliverer from Babylon, Christ is the deliverer from sin and the world. Related verses: Isaiah 42:1. See notes ISA 42:1 God puts his Spirit in those he delights. Related verses: Isaiah 42:1. See notes

item.title: ISA 41
item.description: ISA 41:25 Cyrus the Great was a believer of the God of Israel Related verses: Isaiah 41:25. See notes

item.title: ISA 40
item.description: ISA 40:29 When weary, I need strength that comes from God. When tired, I need power Related verses: Isaiah 40:29, Isaiah 40:31. See notes ISA 40:12 Similarities in both verses and Jesus fulfilled the calming of the storm and rebuking the wind. He also walked on water Related verses: Proverbs 30:4-5, Isaiah 40:12. See notes ISA 40:31 Prayer is waiting on God. It gives strength Related verses: Isaiah 40:31. See notes

item.title: PRO 30
item.description: PRO 30:4 Similarities in both verses and Jesus fulfilled the calming of the storm and rebuking the wind. He also walked on water Related verses: Proverbs 30:4-5, Isaiah 40:12. See notes

item.title: 2KI 20
item.description: 2KI 20:18 These were the likes of Daniel, Azariah, Mishael and Hananiah Related verses: 2 Kings 20:18. See notes 2KI 20:14 God had always warned against Alliance with Babylon. Babylon was the beginning of the kingdom of Nimrod from where occultism began and all sorts of sun worship. God has always been against Babylon from the beginning of time till the end of time Related verses: 2 Kings 20:14. See notes

item.title: 2CH 32
item.description: 2CH 32:25 Pride brought judgement. After repentance, the judgement didn’t stop, it was just transferred to the next generation. It was prolonged Related verses: 2 Chronicles 32:25-26. See notes 2CH 32:19 God cannot be equated to the idols of wood and stone Related verses: 2 Chronicles 32:19. See notes 2CH 32:18 The Assyrians employed the tactics of fear to paralyse their opponents into quick surrender and save them resources that would have been spent besieging a city for a long time

item.title: MIC 2
item.description: MIC 2:3 God judges a nation when the leaders become corrupt. Different elements of judgement are implored. famine, sword or wild animsls. The aim is usually to rid the land of its inhabitants so that the land can enjoy its rest. Related verses: Micah 2:3. See notes

item.title: ISA 32
item.description: ISA 32:17 The seed of divine wisdom produces the fruit of righteousness and this also brings forth peace Related verses: Isaiah 32:17, James 3:18. See notes

item.title: JAS 3
item.description: JAS 3:18 The seed of divine wisdom produces the fruit of righteousness and this also brings forth peace Related verses: Isaiah 32:17, James 3:18. See notes JAS 3:16 Be strong in the Lord. Not in the gym, or physics, fighting, sports or in PhD. Don’t get me wrong. Being strong in education or gym is good but the main aim is to be strong in the Lord and in the power of his might.

item.title: 1SA 2
item.description: 1SA 2:9 By the arm of flesh shall no man prevail. Assyrian was conquering nations and as small nations were taking cover for protection in Egypt under Pharaoh Shabako, Israel was also tempted to do the same and God was warning them but they didn’t listen and neither did they want to repent of idolatry. Related verses: 1 Samuel 2:9, Isaiah 31:1, Jeremiah 17:5. See notes 1SA 2:32 God cursed his household.

item.title: ISA 31
item.description: ISA 31:1 By the arm of flesh shall no man prevail. Assyrian was conquering nations and as small nations were taking cover for protection in Egypt under Pharaoh Shabako, Israel was also tempted to do the same and God was warning them but they didn’t listen and neither did they want to repent of idolatry. Related verses: 1 Samuel 2:9, Isaiah 31:1, Jeremiah 17:5. See notes

item.title: JER 17
item.description: JER 17:5 By the arm of flesh shall no man prevail. Assyrian was conquering nations and as small nations were taking cover for protection in Egypt under Pharaoh Shabako, Israel was also tempted to do the same and God was warning them but they didn’t listen and neither did they want to repent of idolatry. Related verses: 1 Samuel 2:9, Isaiah 31:1, Jeremiah 17:5. See notes

item.title: ISA 27
item.description: ISA 27:1 An answer and a confirmation to a prayer. I just need to be patient and wait for the day God will act Related verses: Isaiah 27:1. See notes

item.title: ACT 10
item.description: ACT 10:20 The Holy Spirit sent an angel to Cornelius to send men to Peter and the Holy Spirit spoke to Peter himself. Could this be because Peter was saved and Cornelius wasn’t yet saved. Meaning the Holy Spirit speaks to the believers only. Related verses: Acts 10:19-20. See notes ACT 10:8 Cornelius explanation ensured that the work would be carried out effectively. Related verses: Acts 10:8. See notes ACT 10:4 Cornelius prayer and offering invoked the mercy of God to see that he and his family received salvation even though he was a Roman officer.

item.title: PSA 146
item.description: PSA 146:7 Jesus fed the hungry and opened the eyes of the blind Related verses: Psalms 146:7-8. See notes

item.title: PSA 132
item.description: PSA 132:9 The priests wore white garments as a symbol of purity and righteousness Related verses: Psalms 132:9. See notes PSA 132:3 David’s devotion to ensure that God is worshipped and his honour is upholded Related verses: Psalms 132:3-5. See notes

item.title: PSA 119
item.description: PSA 119:3 Those that walk in God’s ways and keep his commandments no unrighteousness Related verses: Psalms 119:3. See notes PSA 119:11 For me to see God, I must have a godly character. This can be achieved by keeping and storing his word in my heart. Related verses: Psalms 119:11, Matthew 5:8. See notes PSA 119:101 Sin prevent us from obeying God. Related verses: PSALM 119:101. See notes PSA 119:18 Oh Lord, open my eyes that I may see

item.title: MRK 1
item.description: MRK 1:4 A change of thinking patterns which then affects the actions Related verses: Mark 1:4. See notes MRK 1:22 The God-given authority to teach came after he had been baptized in water and by the Holy Spirit. Related verses: Mark 1:22. See notes MRK 1:4 Baptism was an outward sign of repentance of sin and turning to God to be forgiven Related verses: Mark 1:4. See notes MRK 1:3 God is calling Jesus Lord here showing that Jesus has a higher status.

item.title: PSA 56
item.description: PSA 56:4 When I trust God I won’t fear men. trusting God is reverencing God. to do this, I need to trust in him. Taking his word seriously and acting on it Related verses: Psalms 56:4. See notes PSA 56:3 Faith and trust in God overrides fear and doubt Related verses: PSALM 56:3. See notes

item.title: ACT 9
item.description: ACT 9:25 Saul had gained disciples in the space of three years Related verses: Acts 9:25. See notes ACT 9:17 Saul had become born again and was praying but Ananias had to go to him to lay hands on him not just to receive his sight but to be filled with the Holy Spirit. When Philip the evangelist preached in Samaria, Apostle Peter and John had to come and lay hands on the people of Samaria to receive the Holy Spirit.

item.title: MAT 26
item.description: MAT 26:55 Day after day Jesus taught in the temple Related verses: Matthew 26:55. See notes MAT 26:44 Jesus had said where two or three are gathered in his name, the father would answer the prayers. On this principle, Jesus took Peter, James and John so they could intercede for him not to face the suffering on the cross. Jesus returned to his disciples to receive confirmation of his answered prayer but the answer was no, they were all sleeping so prayer couldn’t be answered.

item.title: MAT 6
item.description: MAT 6:12 I have tickets go of other people’s moral failures and resentments before coming to God to ask for forgiveness Related verses: Matthew 6:12. See notes MAT 6:25 Life is not about food and drinks and neither is the body about clothes to wear. this is the desire of the earthly and carnally minded man. This is why when people humbled themselves and wanted to draw closer to God, they removed the distractions by fasting and putting on rags (sackcloth) as a sign of mourning

item.title: ACT 7
item.description: ACT 7:59 The spirit of man goes to heaven. The soul goes to hell, the body perishes on the earth Related verses: Ecclesiastes 12:7, Luke 23:46, Acts 7:59. See notes ACT 7:33 To take off one?s shoe is to show respect and humility. Slaves in old times didn?t wear sandals. Only their masters did and the slaves were required to stoop down to untie the master?s sandals. In so doing.

item.title: ECC 12
item.description: ECC 12:7 The spirit of man goes to heaven. The soul goes to hell, the body perishes on the earth Related verses: Ecclesiastes 12:7, Luke 23:46, Acts 7:59. See notes ECC 12:11 The one shepherd being God Related verses: Ecclesiastes 12:11. See notes ECC 12:14 Shows God’s sovereignty and that he is the ultimate judge Related verses: Ecclesiastes 12:14. See notes ECC 12:9 A wise man teaches people knowledge. A wise man ponders over facts.

item.title: LUK 23
item.description: LUK 23:46 The spirit of man goes to heaven. The soul goes to hell, the body perishes on the earth Related verses: Ecclesiastes 12:7, Luke 23:46, Acts 7:59. See notes

item.title: MAT 25
item.description: MAT 25:41 This is probably the lake of fire and not hell. Related verses: Matthew 25:41. See notes MAT 25:32 The final judgement will be after the second coming of Christ. Related verses: Matthew 25:32. See notes

item.title: MAT 3
item.description: MAT 3:16 Jesus was declared the son of God at the baptism in Jordan Related verses: Psalms 2:7, Matthew 3:16-17. See notes MAT 3:15 If John had not baptised Jesus at this time, Jesus would not have been able to get baptised as we can see now that John was put in prison and Jesus needed to go for 40 days and 40 nights to be tempted. Speed is a determinant

item.title: PSA 2
item.description: PSA 2:7 Jesus was declared the son of God at the baptism in Jordan Related verses: Psalms 2:7, Matthew 3:16-17. See notes

item.title: EPH 2
item.description: EPH 2:8 Noah found grace through faith. he was willing to believe against all odds that the prophecies of the flood was real and true and he took action Related verses: Genesis 6:8, Ephesians 2:8-9, Hebrews 11:7. See notes

item.title: GEN 6
item.description: GEN 6:8 Noah found grace through faith. he was willing to believe against all odds that the prophecies of the flood was real and true and he took action Related verses: Genesis 6:8, Ephesians 2:8-9, Hebrews 11:7. See notes GEN 6:3 The Holy Spirit was trying to help man live right but man was given to lust of the flesh, lust of the eyes and the pride of life. God had to take away his spirit and man died a total spiritual death.

item.title: HEB 11
item.description: HEB 11:7 Noah found grace through faith. he was willing to believe against all odds that the prophecies of the flood was real and true and he took action Related verses: Genesis 6:8, Ephesians 2:8-9, Hebrews 11:7. See notes HEB 11:6 Faith(Pistis) is the very seed,the foundation and the ground work to the heart of God. Faith is needed to please God and faith is the result of the word of God.

item.title: PSA 49
item.description: PSA 49:8 The life of man is too costly that the penalty was death. Only God is the author of life and only he has the right to take it. Related verses: Psalms 49:8, Mark 8:35-37. See notes

item.title: ACT 1
item.description: ACT 1:1 I must do before teaching Related verses: Matthew 23:3, Acts 1:1. See notes ACT 1:1 Written by Luke to Theophilus. Jesus first began to do, then he taught. Preaching of salvation should first be from Jerusalem then to the rest of the world Related verses: Acts 1:1. See notes

item.title: MAT 23
item.description: MAT 23:3 I must do before teaching Related verses: Matthew 23:3, Acts 1:1. See notes

item.title: ECC 11
item.description: ECC 11:5 we are born of the flesh to enter into the Kingdom of this world and likewise we must be born of the spirit to enter into the Kingdom of God. Just as we don’t know how bones are formed in the womb of a woman, likewise we don’t know how one is born of the Spirit. Related verses: Ecclesiastes 11:5, John 3:5-8. See notes ECC 11:3 Every investment made to people’s life will in due time yield a massive increase

item.title: JHN 3
item.description: JHN 3:6 we are born of the flesh to enter into the Kingdom of this world and likewise we must be born of the spirit to enter into the Kingdom of God. Just as we don’t know how bones are formed in the womb of a woman, likewise we don’t know how one is born of the Spirit. Related verses: Ecclesiastes 11:5, John 3:5-8. See notes JHN 3:17 God has always given man a second chance before initiating a final judgement as we can see in the times of Noah, the Judges, Lot etc.

item.title: MAT 22
item.description: MAT 22:46 He silenced the Pharisees and muzzled the Saducees. If the group who are most knowledgeable of the scripture can be silenced, who else can? Related verses: Matthew 22:46. See notes MAT 22:21 It is false balance to do well in God and not in other areas and vice versa. Jesus used wisdom without offending both parties. Lord I need wisdom Related verses: Matthew 22:21. See notes MAT 22:12 This kinda sounds similar to the story of Anagkazo where those who were invited gave excuses.

item.title: PRO 27
item.description: PRO 27:18 Honour begets honour Related verses: Proverbs 27:18. See notes

item.title: PRO 26
item.description: PRO 26:20 for lack of wood the fire goes out. when sacrifice and dying to self ends, the fire of the Holy Spirit goes out and I become a cold Christian Related verses: Proverbs 26:20. See notes PRO 26:10 everything must be thoughtful and calculated Related verses: Proverbs 26:10. See notes PRO 26:12 This chapter has been talking about the negativity of foolishness and how it can greatly damage a person’s reputation, ideas and progress.

item.title: PRO 25
item.description: PRO 25:25 very refreshing Related verses: Proverbs 25:25. See notes PRO 25:19 painful and unreliable Related verses: Proverbs 25:19. See notes

item.title: 2CH 30
item.description: 2CH 30:20 A right heart with pure intentions when combined with prayer can overrule a law or rule that God has initially pronounced as long as it’s not done with malice Related verses: 2 Chronicles 30:20. See notes

item.title: ECC 8
item.description: ECC 8:2 I must be very careful of keeping oaths and taking words serious Related verses: Ecclesiastes 8:2. See notes ECC 8:8 Jesus demonstrated that he had authority over the wind and death when he first calmed the storm and when he willingly gave up his spirit and rose from the dead Related verses: Ecclesiastes 8:8, Mark 8:26-27. See notes

item.title: HOS 13
item.description: HOS 13:6 Satisfaction brings about complacency and this makes people forget God Related verses: Hosea 13:6. See notes

item.title: HOS 12
item.description: HOS 12:10 Visions are given to make God’s will known and parables are given to activate the conscience Related verses: Hosea 12:10. See notes HOS 12:1 the east wind brings destruction Related verses: Hosea 12:1. See notes HOS 12:4 Jacob was a man that valued blessings. He override the curses of Adam and thieves by stealing blessings from Esau. He also made a covenant with God that provoked blessings in the form of tithing.

item.title: ISA 6
item.description: ISA 6:8 Before Isaiah was commissioned, his sins had to be purged with burning coals from the altar Related verses: Isaiah 6:7-8. See notes

item.title: AMO 7
item.description: AMO 7:3 Because of an intercessor, judgement was revoked Related verses: Amos 7:3. See notes

item.title: AMO 4
item.description: AMO 4:4 Tithes were paid to idols every three days Related verses: Amos 4:4. See notes

item.title: JON 4
item.description: JON 4:11 Jonah did not perform miracles but there unbelieving Nations of Nineveh relented at the preaching of Nineveh. The people of Israel saw Jesus perform many mighty miracles but did not repent. Jonah was a mere prophet. Jesus is the son of God. Inspite of these, they did not repent so their judgement will be more severe Related verses: Jonah 4:11. See notes

item.title: JON 3
item.description: JON 3:10 I must not declare judgement without warning the offender Related verses: Jonah 3:10. See notes

item.title: 2CH 26
item.description: 2CH 26:10 Under the guidance of Zechariah, Uzziah prospered and even built towers in the desert. He was a lover of the soil. He was wise because he built a lot of things and because her feared God Related verses: 2 Chronicles 26:10. See notes 2CH 26:5 God granted him prosperity as long as he sought God. He had Zechariah as his mentor. It is important to have a God-fearing adviser who can teach you the right way to go especially when you are a young king and lacking experience in things.

item.title: 2KI 5
item.description: 2KI 5:5 1 talent of gold was approximately 15 years of wages. Naaman brought Related verses: 2 Kings 5:5. See notes 2KI 5:17 If Elisha had received the presents, he would have denied God of his glory because Naaman only thought of collecting the soil to worship God after his gifts had been rejected Related verses: 2 Kings 5:17. See notes 2KI 5:16 God does not collect before he gives.

item.title: 2CH 24
item.description: 2CH 24:15 Jehoiada the high priest was honoured and buried in the King’s tomb even though he was a priest. he also loved long. he was the husband of Joash’s sister Related verses: 2 Chronicles 24:15-16. See notes 2CH 24:15 he lived to be very old and full of years Related verses: 2 Chronicles 24:15. See notes

item.title: 2CH 22
item.description: 2CH 22:12 While Joash grandmother Athaliah wanted to murder him, he was saved by his aunt and lived with them in the temple. This was an opportunity to learn the ways of God from a young age Related verses: 2 Chronicles 22:12. See notes

item.title: 2KI 8
item.description: 2KI 8:4 Gehazi got the leprosy after the famine because the lady whom Elisha raised her son from the dead came to the king after the famine Related verses: 2 Kings 8:4. See notes

item.title: MAT 10
item.description: MAT 10:8 God does not collect before he gives. Freely you have received, freely give. Our life is meant to embody the law and the prophets like Jesus did Related verses: 2 Kings 5:16, Matthew 10:8. See notes MAT 10:40 Anyone who receives a human born sent by God is receiving God directly. There so a reward for receiving a man of God Related verses: Matthew 10:40-41. See notes MAT 10:36 Jesus instructions to his disciples

item.title: 2CH 20
item.description: 2CH 20:37 My company can make or ruin me. Jehoshaphat decided to have an alliance with a man God considered wicked. Related verses: 2 Chronicles 20:37. See notes 2CH 20:3 for seeking the Lord, he proclaimed a fast Related verses: 2 Chronicles 20:3. See notes 2CH 20:23 It is very possible that what happened was along these lines: Moab and Ammon are descended from lot whereas Edom and Israel are descended from Isaac.

item.title: MAT 12
item.description: MAT 12:26 Satan also has a kingdom Related verses: Matthew 12:26. See notes MAT 12:10 Jesus had just been confronted about eating grains on the Sabbath and now he has decided to go to the Synagogue and they questioned him if it was lawful to heal on the Sabbath. Which means they knew he was going to heal anyone who was sick. Which also means people came to the Synagogue because they also knew Jesus was going to heal

item.title: 1KI 3
item.description: 1KI 3:28 The word of God as the sword of the spirit dividing the soul and the spirit to reveal the thoughts and intentions of the heart Related verses: 1 Kings 3:24, 1 Kings 3:27-28, Luke 2:35, Hebrews 4:12. See notes 1KI 3:28 The wisdom of God is important in administering justice as was given to Solomon Related verses: 1 Kings 3:28. See notes 1KI 3:28 The wisdom of God would make people reverence you.

item.title: HEB 4
item.description: HEB 4:12 The word of God as the sword of the spirit dividing the soul and the spirit to reveal the thoughts and intentions of the heart Related verses: 1 Kings 3:24, 1 Kings 3:27-28, Luke 2:35, Hebrews 4:12. See notes HEB 4:12 The sword of the spirit (the word of God). The true intentions of the two prostitutes were revealed after the sword was brought to be used Related verses: 1 Kings 3:24, Hebrews 4:12.

item.title: LUK 2
item.description: LUK 2:35 The word of God as the sword of the spirit dividing the soul and the spirit to reveal the thoughts and intentions of the heart Related verses: 1 Kings 3:24, 1 Kings 3:27-28, Luke 2:35, Hebrews 4:12. See notes LUK 2:23 I believe the parents of Jesus were poor. The law said anyone who couldn’t afford a lamb to redeem the first son that opens the womb should offer a pair of turtle doves or two young pigeon (Leviticus 12:8) and that’s exactly what the parents of Jesus did.

item.title: MAT 11
item.description: MAT 11:21 the working of miracles was to change the hearts of people to repent Related verses: Matthew 11:21. See notes MAT 11:27 We don’t fully know Christ or the father unless Jesus makes him known to us Related verses: Matthew 11:27. See notes MAT 11:29 Even though Solomon was wise, to accomplish his building mission, he had to put people under forced labour. His yoke was heavy. When we compare Jesus to Solomon, Jesus was wiser than Solomon yet his yoke was lighter.

item.title: 1KI 17
item.description: 1KI 17:12 When all hope was lost in a corrupt land, God sent an Elijah to a widow in an unbelieving city Related verses: 1 Kings 17:12. See notes 1KI 17:19 When the woman surrendered the dead boy to the man of God, God resurrected him and brought him back to the woman. The boy was taken to the upper room before he got resurrected after which he was taken back down.

item.title: 1KI 14
item.description: 1KI 14:24 these male cult orodtitutes engaged in homosexual acts. this was the lot of Sodom and Gomorrah before they were destroyed Related verses: 1 Kings 14:24. See notes 1KI 14:9 God was provoked to anger because of idolatry and considered it evil Related verses: 1 Kings 14:9. See notes 1KI 14:26 After all the labour that Solomon had subjected men to in acquiring all these good works, all was vanity as Shishak the brother-in-law of Jeroboam ransacked the temple in Jerusalem and took away all the shields of gold

item.title: 1KI 13
item.description: 1KI 13:18 the prophet lied to the man of God than an angel had appeared to him to I form the man if God to go back and eat (thus contradicting the instructions that God gave the man of God). no angel or man should be able to make me disobey the clear words given to me by God. this was the same error that Adam and Eve committed after God has given a clear instruction.

item.title: GAL 1
item.description: GAL 1:8 the prophet lied to the man of God than an angel had appeared to him to I form the man if God to go back and eat (thus contradicting the instructions that God gave the man of God). no angel or man should be able to make me disobey the clear words given to me by God. this was the same error that Adam and Eve committed after God has given a clear instruction.

item.title: 1KI 12
item.description: 1KI 12:7 Leadership starts with humility and servanthood. Rehoboam listened to the wrong advice and lost most of the kingdom. The people weren’t interested in being completely free. All they asked for was the burden to be lighter but Rehoboam in his foolishness lost the people’s support by being unreasonable Related verses: 1 Kings 12:7. See notes 1KI 12:27 Doubt can rob us of God’s promises. Even though God had elevated Jeroboam and have made him king of Israel and made a covenant to obey God, he decided to make the Israelites serve calves as they did before in the wilderness after they went away from Egypt.

item.title: DAN 6
item.description: DAN 6:18 This is another type of fast where there is no eating in the evening and music, pleasure and entertainment is disregarded Related verses: Daniel 6:18. See notes DAN 6:7 A way to trap Daniel was through the law of his God. God wants us to establish authority and this should only change when the law of our rulers directly conflicts the law of God. The Medes and the Persians along with the Egyptians also engaged in human worship

item.title: DAN 5
item.description: DAN 5:27 A throne is established by righteous judgement. Belshazzar was found wanting on the scale of righteousness and judgement has been set. the climax of his unrighteous act was dishonouring God by drinking from the cup of God and praising idols Related verses: Daniel 5:27. See notes DAN 5:18 It was God who have King Nebuchadnezzar the kingdom as well as greatness, glory and majesty. this compelled nations to be subjected to him

item.title: ECC 10
item.description: ECC 10:16 knowing the right time to have pleasure Related verses: Ecclesiastes 10:16. See notes ECC 10:20 He cursed the king and the punishment that David saw fit was death. I must be careful not to curse God or even the leader he has placed above me even in my thoughts because nothing is secret in this world. it’s only a matter of time Related verses: Exodus 22:28, 2 Samuel 16:5, 1 Kings 2:9, Ecclesiastes 10:20.

item.title: ECC 7
item.description: ECC 7:26 Sexual immorality can easily take one away from God that is why the Bible warns against sexual immorality. Sexual immorality is the physical counterpart if spiritual immorality or adultery which is idolatry. It breaks relationship and God’s law. these two are contained in the 10 commandments and the commandments were summarised to loving God and loving others Related verses: Ecclesiastes 7:26. See notes ECC 7:19 there is no substitute for wisdom

item.title: ECC 5
item.description: ECC 5:19 the blessings of God makes rich and there is no sorrow attached Related verses: Proverbs 10:22, Ecclesiastes 5:19. See notes ECC 5:8 Trying to fix everything means a war with the system because the corrupt official has a backing from a higher power Related verses: Ecclesiastes 5:8. See notes ECC 5:6 It’s better to be careful with words and not make false vows before God lest the work of your hands be destroyed.

item.title: MAT 5
item.description: MAT 5:37 It’s better to be careful with words and not make false vows before God lest the work of your hands be destroyed. Simple yes and no is fine to avoid lying Related verses: Ecclesiastes 5:6, Matthew 5:33-37. See notes MAT 5:42 Anyone who ignores the poor would suffer. it said he himself would CRY then he would not be heard. If I love the lord and my neighbour, I’ll definitely give to the poor

item.title: ECC 4
item.description: ECC 4:14 wisdom can change situations and can make a prisoner a freeman Related verses: Ecclesiastes 4:14. See notes ECC 4:12 the power of unity Related verses: Ecclesiastes 4:12. See notes ECC 4:10 Company is important as it helps to keep each other up. A lone ranger is a target Related verses: Ecclesiastes 4:10. See notes ECC 4:8 The soul is the entity that is judged and that which God requires.

item.title: LUK 12
item.description: LUK 12:18 The soul is the entity that is judged and that which God requires. Life and accomplishments and labours without God is vain and useless. God has made sure that we human are dependent beings on him and we cause ourselves problems when we decide to revel against him and live our own lives. It debased us to live like mere animals as we are without God. Related verses: Ecclesiastes 4:8, Luke 12:16-21.

item.title: ECC 3
item.description: ECC 3:15 it is God’s purpose for history to repeat itself and so does the Bible maintain this cyclical pattern of people living the life of the Messiah Related verses: Ecclesiastes 3:15. See notes

item.title: ECC 2
item.description: ECC 2:8 Solomon started with tolerance of evil and this desensitized him until he disobeyed God and openly practised idolatry. this is what the media is doing to make people think a lot of things that God is against us really normal Related verses: Ecclesiastes 2:8. See notes

item.title: SNG 7
item.description: SNG 7:3 vivid description of the bride from the feet to the head Related verses: Song of Solomon 7:1-8. See notes

item.title: SNG 2
item.description: SNG 2:5 Lord let me be sick for your love. let me become addicted to your love. They say love us blind, blind me to everything but you Jesus. May I be possessed with your being. overcome my desire for anything but you Related verses: Song of Solomon 2:5. See notes SNG 2:2 Jesus my lily among the thorns. the one that blossoms when everything around is dead. the one who shines in the dark.

item.title: DAN 4
item.description: DAN 4:36 God is so wonderful in the sense that he adds to our glory after we have fallen or been through a time of testing. examples are Job, Joseph, Nebuchadnezzar and Jesus etc. Related verses: Daniel 4:36. See notes DAN 4:30 Babylon talks of a city or venture built by the strength and wisdom of men and with which God is not given the honor or glory in it.

item.title: MAT 8
item.description: MAT 8:10 Knowledge empowers faith. Ignorance and faith don’t work together. everyone Jesus healed knew something about God and chose to believe him at his word. Ignorance is the greatest detriment to faith. without knowledge, it will be difficult to believe Related verses: Matthew 8:10. See notes MAT 8:13 This time as well, we see God willing to heal the centurion servant. He was first acknowledged as Lord as with the other leper who got cleaned in the first verse.

item.title: PRO 24
item.description: PRO 24:18 Even though God wants to fight for me. if he sees me rejoicing over my enemy when they fall, he will be displeased and won’t take action anymore because the fee had been paid by my rejoicing at the fall of my enemy Related verses: Proverbs 24:17-18. See notes PRO 24:11 there’s nothing like it’s none of my business Related verses: Proverbs 24:11-12. See notes PRO 24:5 When it comes to God, it’s not about strength but wisdom.

item.title: PRO 23
item.description: PRO 23:27 A trap and a highway to hell and the grave Related verses: Proverbs 23:27. See notes PRO 23:21 Poverty is to a glutton and a drunkard Related verses: Proverbs 23:20-21. See notes PRO 23:11 God will personally fight for the fatherless and the poor and the widow Related verses: Proverbs 23:10-11. See notes

item.title: PRO 22
item.description: PRO 22:29 the value of skill Related verses: Proverbs 22:29. See notes PRO 22:22 God is careful about the poor. they must not be oppressed otherwise he will tlrose to fight those who do Related verses: Proverbs 22:22-23. See notes PRO 22:16 God does not joke with the poor. Opressing or exploiting the poor leads to curses but giving to the poor leads to blessings. Related verses: Proverbs 22:16. See notes

item.title: DAN 3
item.description: DAN 3:15 This has been the statement of mighty rulers before their downfall. Senacherrib taunted the God of Israel as well as Nebuchadnezzar before their downfall Related verses: 2 Chronicles 32:13-17, Daniel 3:15. See notes DAN 3:18 In the case of the three Hebrew men who refused to bow down to the idol. They were convicted and would rather lose their life than worship an idol. They boldly went against the order of the king even though the penalty was being roasted to ashes.

item.title: PRO 21
item.description: PRO 21:13 Anyone who ignores the poor would suffer. it said he himself would CRY then he would not be heard. If I love the lord and my neighbour, I’ll definitely give to the poor Related verses: Proverbs 21:13, Matthew 5:42. See notes PRO 21:23 Your mouth and what you say determines the course of your life Related verses: PROVERBS 21:23. See notes PRO 21:22 Wisdom is better than strength.

item.title: JOB 2
item.description: JOB 2:7 The threshing wheel separates the chaff from the wheat by subjecting the grain to pressure when it is treaded on by both the wheels and the cow threshing the grain. Satan petitioned God to have Job sifted like wheat but Job’s faith did not fail. Satan demanded that Peter would be tested as well but his faith did not fail even when he denied Jesus and went back to fishing.

item.title: LUK 22
item.description: LUK 22:31 The threshing wheel separates the chaff from the wheat by subjecting the grain to pressure when it is treaded on by both the wheels and the cow threshing the grain. Satan petitioned God to have Job sifted like wheat but Job’s faith did not fail. Satan demanded that Peter would be tested as well but his faith did not fail even when he denied Jesus and went back to fishing.

item.title: PRO 20
item.description: PRO 20:26 The threshing wheel separates the chaff from the wheat by subjecting the grain to pressure when it is treaded on by both the wheels and the cow threshing the grain. Satan petitioned God to have Job sifted like wheat but Job’s faith did not fail. Satan demanded that Peter would be tested as well but his faith did not fail even when he denied Jesus and went back to fishing.

item.title: DAN 2
item.description: DAN 2:49 Daniel did not forget his friends when he was elevated Related verses: Daniel 2:49. See notes DAN 2:17 In the multitude of counsel there is safety. I need like-minded companions Related verses: Daniel 2:17. See notes DAN 2:48 The dream revealed what was to come in the future and a Jew became ruler in a foreign land through the revelation of dreams. Related verses: Daniel 2:48. See notes

item.title: PRO 19
item.description: PRO 19:24 A sluggard can’t complete tasks Related verses: Proverbs 19:24. See notes PRO 19:19 I must learn self-control and not be driven by anger or quick temper Related verses: Proverbs 19:19. See notes PRO 19:5 A liar and a false witness are abomination to God and will never go unpunished Related verses: PROVERBS 19:5. See notes

item.title: PRO 18
item.description: PRO 18:24 Not everyone can be friends. the more friends I have, the easier it is to fall away from the true path Related verses: Proverbs 18:24. See notes PRO 18:21 tongues have power. they are ways by which the desire of the soul (thoughts of the mind, desires of the will and the feelings of the emotion) are expressed Related verses: Proverbs 18:21. See notes PRO 18:16 Giving a gift is a symbol of honour and that you thought about the person

item.title: DAN 1
item.description: DAN 1:7 names are used as identity and they have meaning. they reveal the character and attributes of a person. The four men’s names were changed to affect their desire for the true God. Israel wanted to serve idols and God gave them their desires and took them to a land where they could serve a lot of gods. Everything in Babylon was set up to change the culture and mindset of the Israelites but Daniel, Azariah, Mishael and Hananiah were different.

item.title: PRO 17
item.description: PRO 17:27 This is talking to me. I need to be careful with my words and I must be temperate and have self control. no need to be unnecessarily angry Related verses: Proverbs 17:27. See notes PRO 17:16 Common sense is needed to keep sound wisdom Related verses: Proverbs 17:16. See notes PRO 17:14 words of wisdom. no need to waste time fighting Related verses: Proverbs 17:14. See notes PRO 17:13 Lord have mercy.

item.title: MAT 4
item.description: MAT 4:12 If John had not baptised Jesus at this time, Jesus would not have been able to get baptised as we can see now that John was put in prison and Jesus needed to go for 40 days and 40 nights to be tempted. Speed is a determinant Related verses: Matthew 3:15, Matthew 4:12. See notes MAT 4:11 Angels brought Elijah food which powered him for 40 days and 40 nights journey.

item.title: PRO 16
item.description: PRO 16:7 God is the author of peace. Fearing and pleasing God causes peace to abound on all sides. Example was Solomon before his fall Related verses: Proverbs 16:7. See notes PRO 16:6 If I want to depart from evil, I must reverence God and this is God’s wisdom and greatness in God’s sight. An example is Job who feared God and shunned evil and was described as the greatest of the men of the east.

item.title: JOB 1
item.description: JOB 1:1 If I want to depart from evil, I must reverence God and this is God’s wisdom and greatness in God’s sight. An example is Job who feared God and shunned evil and was described as the greatest of the men of the east. Related verses: Job 1:1, Job 28:28, Proverbs 16:6. See notes JOB 1:1 the reason is because Solomon’s wisdom was not of this world. it was God’s wisdom.

item.title: JOB 28
item.description: JOB 28:28 If I want to depart from evil, I must reverence God and this is God’s wisdom and greatness in God’s sight. An example is Job who feared God and shunned evil and was described as the greatest of the men of the east. Related verses: Job 1:1, Job 28:28, Proverbs 16:6. See notes

item.title: PRO 15
item.description: PRO 15:33 Humility and the fear of the Lord is the key to wisdom and honour. these generates riches, honour and life Related verses: Proverbs 15:33, Proverbs 22:4. See notes PRO 15:32 Learning from rebukes is the key to change. People can see about me what I can’t see about myself so I need to be willing to listen to them otherwise I don’t love myself. Accepting correction helps me in acquiring wisdom

item.title: 1TI 6
item.description: 1TI 6:6 reverencing God is compared to having trouble with great treasure. When I fear God, I will have peace of mind. I must be content with what I have. Godliness with contentment is great gain Related verses: Proverbs 15:16, 1 Timothy 6:6. See notes 1TI 6:10 A lover of money is a dangerous person Related verses: Mark 14:11, 1 Timothy 6:10. See notes

item.title: PRO 14
item.description: PRO 14:33 wisdomis of the heart and wisdom comes wge there is understanding of a particular subject matter Related verses: Proverbs 14:33. See notes PRO 14:31 giving and showing mercy to the poor is a way to honour God Related verses: Proverbs 14:31. See notes PRO 14:4 there’s got to be some bad to achieve something good. I can’t eat my cake and have it. Anybody will have both good and bad character.

item.title: MAT 7
item.description: MAT 7:24 the solid foundation of God’s word. it is like a solid rock that the Lord Jesus mentions in Matthew 7:24 Related verses: Proverbs 14:1, Matthew 7:24. See notes MAT 7:26 The whirlwind is a sign of divine judgement. it affects everything and anything not built on a solid foundation is carried away. Likewise, the wicked are blown away like chaff before the wind but the righteous has a solid foundation because they keep the word of God (Jesus) and are made righteous and are guided to the path of righteousness

item.title: PRO 13
item.description: PRO 13:20 Who are my company. I am influenced by my company Related verses: Proverbs 13:20. See notes PRO 13:18 Anyone who is poor is proud because he refuses instruction and discipline Related verses: Proverbs 13:18. See notes PRO 13:13 Despise or respect destruction or reward I have to choose to obey God to be rewarded Related verses: Proverbs 13:13. See notes PRO 13:11 The key is gathering in crumbs through honesty

item.title: PRO 12
item.description: PRO 12:27 diligence and opportunity. knowing the right time and taking the chance Related verses: Proverbs 12:27. See notes PRO 12:25 I must learn to be an encourager. Related verses: Proverbs 12:25. See notes PRO 12:24 Diligence makes a leader. Lazy and negligent people are subjected to servitude Related verses: Proverbs 12:24. See notes PRO 12:23 even a wise man has the proper time to speak Related verses: Proverbs 12:23. See notes

item.title: PRO 11
item.description: PRO 11:29 A wise man is prone to becoming a leader while a foolish man can only be subjected to service Related verses: Proverbs 11:29. See notes PRO 11:25 Generosity is a seed that will bring returns in the future. Related verses: Proverbs 11:25. See notes PRO 11:15 I must not be a guarantor for anyone otherwise I’ll suffer terribly from the consequence Related verses: Proverbs 11:15. See notes PRO 11:30 Righteousness saves you from eternal condemnation and by winning souls, you gather up rewards for eternity with God.

item.title: LUK 20
item.description: LUK 20:4 Baptism is an agreement and outward sign and public declaration of an inner change of mind and heart. Because it is public, it is visible to the public and humbling because people will see you and will know you agree that you are a sinner. it took humility to be baptised. Christ was humble enough to get baptised. John was baptised from heaven (ordained by God. he was filled with the Holy Spirit from birth).

item.title: ECC 9
item.description: ECC 9:11 Opportunities (time and chance) come at various stages of our lives. When we lose opportunities, we are actually foolish and have acted shamefully especially when the harvest (of souls) is ripe Related verses: Proverbs 10:5, Ecclesiastes 9:11. See notes ECC 9:10 If I’m serving God I should do it with all my might. This has to come from my heart first. when I’m interested in doing something, I will go all out.

item.title: PRO 9
item.description: PRO 9:12 At the end of the day, I real the benefits of my choice whether to choose God’s wisdom or not Related verses: Proverbs 9:12. See notes PRO 9:11 Divine Wisdom prolongs life and gives vigour and energy and strengtg to my life Related verses: Proverbs 9:11. See notes PRO 9:10 Knowledge of God is important because it gives is the understanding to know God and once we know God, we can truly learn how to reverence him (then comes wisdom through the reverence).

item.title: 1CO 12
item.description: 1CO 12:10 The woman personified as wisdom is the Holy Spirit. The spirit of counsel, wisdom, understanding, power, knowledge as mentioned in Isaiah. wisdom (The Holy Spirit) can provide everything I need. this wisdom personified as a woman was given to Jesus in full measure as seen in Isaiah 11:2. the fruit of wisdom is better than silver or gold. the fruits of wisdom is love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness and faithfulness.

item.title: GAL 5
item.description: GAL 5:22 The woman personified as wisdom is the Holy Spirit. The spirit of counsel, wisdom, understanding, power, knowledge as mentioned in Isaiah. wisdom (The Holy Spirit) can provide everything I need. this wisdom personified as a woman was given to Jesus in full measure as seen in Isaiah 11:2. the fruit of wisdom is better than silver or gold. the fruits of wisdom is love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness and faithfulness.

item.title: ISA 11
item.description: ISA 11:2 The woman personified as wisdom is the Holy Spirit. The spirit of counsel, wisdom, understanding, power, knowledge as mentioned in Isaiah. wisdom (The Holy Spirit) can provide everything I need. this wisdom personified as a woman was given to Jesus in full measure as seen in Isaiah 11:2. the fruit of wisdom is better than silver or gold. the fruits of wisdom is love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness and faithfulness.

item.title: PRO 8
item.description: PRO 8:14 The woman personified as wisdom is the Holy Spirit. The spirit of counsel, wisdom, understanding, power, knowledge as mentioned in Isaiah. wisdom (The Holy Spirit) can provide everything I need. this wisdom personified as a woman was given to Jesus in full measure as seen in Isaiah 11:2. the fruit of wisdom is better than silver or gold. the fruits of wisdom is love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness and faithfulness.

item.title: PSA 45
item.description: PSA 45:7 The woman personified as wisdom is the Holy Spirit. The spirit of counsel, wisdom, understanding, power, knowledge as mentioned in Isaiah. wisdom (The Holy Spirit) can provide everything I need. this wisdom personified as a woman was given to Jesus in full measure as seen in Isaiah 11:2. the fruit of wisdom is better than silver or gold. the fruits of wisdom is love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness and faithfulness.

item.title: JOB 20
item.description: JOB 20:25 the same fate of the wicked. Adultery is also categorised as wickedness Related verses: Job 20:24-25, Proverbs 7:23. See notes

item.title: PRO 7
item.description: PRO 7:23 the same fate of the wicked. Adultery is also categorised as wickedness Related verses: Job 20:24-25, Proverbs 7:23. See notes PRO 7:26 What a great comparison between the Proverbs 7 woman e.g. Delilah and the Proverbs 31 woman e.g. Ruth The Proverbs 7 woman is an immoral woman given to sensual pleasures. Her work is to seek out men who would satisfy her desire even though she was already married.

item.title: PRO 6
item.description: PRO 6:16 Just like Jesus wore the crown of thorns to save us from the wrath and abomination of our heavenly father, A proud look stems from the heart because it is the attitude that overestimates oneself and discount others. Jesus suffered thirst from the tongue the tongue speaks out lies, deceits and is the agent of false witnesses his hands were nailed to the cross his side were pierced (where his heart is located) his feets were pierced Related verses: Proverbs 6:16-19.

item.title: PRO 5
item.description: PRO 5:1 Why do I want to pay the price of the same costly experience when I can just learn from it and avoid pitfalls? Related verses: Proverbs 5:1. See notes

item.title: PRO 4
item.description: PRO 4:18 The way of the righteous keeps getting brighter and brighter whereas that of the wicked is like deep darkness Related verses: Proverbs 4:18-19. See notes PRO 4:10 If I want long life, I better take heed to the word of God Related verses: Proverbs 4:10. See notes

item.title: MAT 1
item.description: MAT 1:21 Joseph needed to name Jesus for Jesus to be legal on earth. everything that God created was given a name and remained under his dominion. everything that was kept under the dominion of man was given a name by man. Name reveals attributes and personality and Jesus being named by Joseph gave him the personality as saviour. The angels couldn’t name Jesus so a man had to do it.

item.title: PRO 3
item.description: PRO 3:4 I find favour in the sight of God and man because of the three qualities: mercy, kindness and truth. mercy and truth because God desires both and kindness in judgement will make me show compassion. God is full of compassion Related verses: Proverbs 3:4. See notes PRO 3:1 backsliding starts from the heart and that is why I must keep my heart with all diligence. I won’t forget the teachings of wisdom when I have rehearsed it continually until it becomes part of me

item.title: PSA 121
item.description: PSA 121:2 The hills of Jerusalem (City of peace) is where the high places of worship was located before Solomon built the temple on mount Moriah. Looking up to the hills is looking up to God and trusting him for provision. I cannot rely on man to provide for me but only God is the source and provider of my needs and is very happy to do so. God will be there to keep the path I walk when I live righteously.

item.title: Oh Lord Majesty
item.description: Oh Lord, majesty we come, prince of peace glory to your Holy name glory to your Holy name

item.title: PRO 2
item.description: PRO 2:1 Seeking the knowledge of God as if mining gold is the criteria to finding wisdom. it’s not easy to get treasures and neither is it easy to know God. only those who knows the value of knowing God will seek him. once we find God, God willbimpart to us his wisdom because we seek him on the basis of his word and the more we know his word, the more we start to become acquainted with him and can know what steps to take if in a dilemma.

item.title: PRO 1
item.description: PRO 1:5 continuous learning helps to renew my mind since ignorance is costly. I must be attentive to words especially by God. the sign that I am wise is in learning and not just reading Related verses: Proverbs 1:5. See notes PRO 1:23 If I pay attention to the rebuke if God’s word, he will pour out the spirit of wisdom on me Related verses: Proverbs 1:23. See notes PRO 1:16 Advice against greed.

item.title: PSA 72
item.description: PSA 72:10 David’s prophecies here happened practically to Solomon. How important it is to be in right standing with a father Related verses: Psalms 72:10. See notes PSA 72:9 subjugation of enemies and a sign of absolute authority Related verses: Psalms 72:9. See notes PSA 72:17 This is probably a prophecy of Jesus the Lord Related verses: Psalms 72:17. See notes PSA 72:1 A prayer of David to David and his son Solomon to Judge righteously

item.title: 1KI 4
item.description: 1KI 4:15 The name sounds Egyptian. she’s probably the daughter of the Egyptian woman he married. Basemath doesn’t sound like an Israeli name. it may be possible, another daughter of Solomon’s foreign wives Related verses: 1 Kings 4:11, 1 Kings 4:15. See notes

item.title: 2CH 1
item.description: 2CH 1:17 the importing of the horses and chariots were actually a means of trade. they sold the horses to the kings of the Hittites and Arameans Related verses: 2 Chronicles 1:17. See notes 2CH 1:14 Disobedience against God’s law that a king is not to multiply chariots so that his heart remains trusting in God and not on weapons of war and natural abilities and skills. this is the beginning of the downfall of Solomon

item.title: DEU 17
item.description: DEU 17:16 Disobedience against God’s law that a king is not to multiply chariots so that his heart remains trusting in God and not on weapons of war and natural abilities and skills. this is the beginning of the downfall of Solomon Related verses: Deuteronomy 17:16, 2 Chronicles 1:14. See notes DEU 17:20 Divine wisdom makes you Wealthy famous builds you a house honoured Solomon even though very wise, his wisdom was turned to foolishness because he disobeyed God in his latter days.

item.title: 2CH 9
item.description: 2CH 9:27 Another thing to note in Solomon’s wisdom is not just in building but in transportation. he controlled nations through control of the trade routes. that way riches reached Israel Related verses: 2 Chronicles 9:27. See notes 2CH 9:26 he was in a way king of kings because of his wisdom Related verses: 2 Chronicles 9:26. See notes 2CH 9:23 the great wisdom of Solomon compelled kings to seek him and to hear his words.

item.title: 1KI 9
item.description: 1KI 9:15 Solomon a wise man was always involved in building projects. He built structures for 20 years. He built the temple, his house, house of Pharaoh’s daughter, he even built fortifications and ships. Related verses: 1 Kings 9:15, 1 Kings 9:17, 1 Kings 9:19, 1 Kings 9:24-25. See notes 1KI 9:5 throne established forever on condition of obedience to God Related verses: 1 Kings 9:5. See notes 1KI 9:2 The second time God appeared to Solomon to confirm that he had answered his prayers.

item.title: 2CH 8
item.description: 2CH 8:14 David the man of God. A man after God’s heart Related verses: 2 Chronicles 8:14. See notes

item.title: GEN 19
item.description: GEN 19:3 A sign of the communion. they had communion before judgement. Jesus had communion before he faced judgement on the cross. The Israelites had communion before judgement fell on Egypt. The communion and the unleavened bread was to show that there is no sin in me and the wine is a sign of purity. After you crush me, you will find no dreggs in me. But Jesus had to drink of the cup of God’s wrath and taste the dreggs.

item.title: EZK 22
item.description: EZK 22:4 God’s judgement was because of idolatry and bloodshed. A direct desecration of the golden rule. To love God and others. Sodom and Gomorrah was involved in this. Homosexuality was a common practise in Sodom and Gomorrah. Male temple prostitutes also engaged in homosexual acts in pagan religion. Before God judges the earth, there had to be an outcry by humans bringing into account the deeds of the offenders.

item.title: LEV 16
item.description: LEV 16:13 the purpose of the incense and the fire was to create a cloud of smoke which would then cover the mercy seat so that the high priest would not come into direct eye contact with God when he sprinkles the blood on the mercy seat. this is because the glory of God will be manifested Related verses: Leviticus 16:2, Leviticus 16:13. See notes LEV 16:15 The High priest was to offer two sacrifices on the day of atonement.

item.title: 2CH 7
item.description: 2CH 7:3 this word of worship is very common in the Bible “For he is good, for his mercies endures forever” Related verses: 2 Chronicles 7:3. See notes 2CH 7:1 Fire came down from the altar and consumed the burnt offering and sacrifices in response to Solomon’s prayer and God’s glory filled the temple Related verses: 2 Chronicles 7:1. See notes

item.title: 1KI 8
item.description: 1KI 8:63 wooow that was a lot of sacrifices. Sacrifices release power no wonder the priests could not even enter the temple to minister because of the intense presence of God (the cloud) Related verses: 1 Kings 8:63. See notes 1KI 8:54 One of the postures of prayer is to kneel down with hands stretched to heaven. Another is standing, sitting or lying down. I believe that this is the basis for which Muslims do their prayer.

item.title: 2CH 6
item.description: 2CH 6:33 The key here is this. Jews and Gentiles could call upon God?s name. According to Solomon?s prayer. Jews should face the temple when in Jerusalem Jerusalem when outside Canaan Gentiles need to be in Jerusalem and face the temple Jews had more privilege by right of birth until Jesus died and the veil of the temple was torn. Elisha saved the soul of Namaan :).

item.title: DEU 8
item.description: DEU 8:3 The manna ceased but the law lasted forever. Man cannot live forever by eating bread or manna but man will have everlasting life if he abides by the word of God. both manna and the commandments were given by God yet one was more important than the other. The commandments lasted generations but the manna didn’t even though both were provided by God. it goes to show that the spiritual is greater than the natural.

item.title: EXO 16
item.description: EXO 16:33 The manna ceased but the law lasted forever. Man cannot live forever by eating bread or manna but man will have everlasting life if he abides by the word of God. both manna and the commandments were given by God yet one was more important than the other. The commandments lasted generations but the manna didn’t even though both were provided by God. it goes to show that the spiritual is greater than the natural.

item.title: ROM 8
item.description: ROM 8:7 The manna ceased but the law lasted forever. Man cannot live forever by eating bread or manna but man will have everlasting life if he abides by the word of God. both manna and the commandments were given by God yet one was more important than the other. The commandments lasted generations but the manna didn’t even though both were provided by God. it goes to show that the spiritual is greater than the natural.

item.title: 2CH 5
item.description: 2CH 5:10 The jar of manna and Aaron’s budded rod had probably been lost because they were both kept in the ark of the covenant along with the two stone tablets that had the 10 commandments written on it. It shows that Aaron’s rod was not meant to last forever neither was the manna but the commandments of God was to last for eternity. Aaron’s budding rod was for a sign, the manna was for a sign and also for temporary sustenance but the law was everlasting.

item.title: 1KI 7
item.description: 1KI 7:14 Hiram was filled with the spirit of wisdom, understanding and skill so he was eligible to build the temple of God. It is worth noting that the writer of Chronicles found it worthy to mention that he had a maternal connection with the Israelites Related verses: 1 Kings 7:14. See notes

item.title: 1KI 6
item.description: 1KI 6:38 The temple was built in 7 years. Solomon was around 31 years at this time. 7 years (a sign of completeness) Related verses: 1 Kings 6:38. See notes 1KI 6:12 Continuing dynasty on obedience Related verses: 1 Kings 6:12. See notes

item.title: 2CH 3
item.description: 2CH 3:1 God also told Abraham to sacrifice Isaac on the mountain of Moriah. I wouldn?t be surprised if it was exactly this location that God sent Abraham to perform the sacrifcie. I checked the NASB Study Bible and it says it was the same spot Related verses: 2 Chronicles 3:1. See notes 2CH 3:1 This verse mentions that David purchased the site for 600 shekels of silver whereas 2 Samuel 24:24 mentions that David purchased the threshing floor and the oxen For 50 shekels of silver.

item.title: 2CH 2
item.description: 2CH 2:6 This verse confirms that there is more than one heaven Related verses: 2 Chronicles 2:6, 2 Corinthians 12:2. See notes 2CH 2:5 Solomon?s confession of God?s sovereignty over all the gods. He was to build a great house for the greatest God Related verses: 2 Chronicles 2:5. See notes

item.title: 2CO 12
item.description: 2CO 12:2 This verse confirms that there is more than one heaven Related verses: 2 Chronicles 2:6, 2 Corinthians 12:2. See notes

item.title: 1KI 5
item.description: 1KI 5:5 immediate commencement of building the temple of God. Solomon orchestrated the building of the temple at a very young age Related verses: 1 Kings 5:5. See notes

item.title: JHN 10
item.description: JHN 10:10 The true state of a shepherd-sheep relationship. The real shepherd interceded on behalf of the sheep while the other sought to destroy the life of the child as she destroyed the life of her son. The thief comes to kill, steal and destroy. Jesus came that we may have life. The word of God is important in discerning good and wise judgement. this is what happens when Satan brings an accusation before the father but Jesus or his followers petitions the father so that they might not be given over to the will of Satan the evil one

item.title: 2CO 4
item.description: 2CO 4:4 Solomon prayed for an understanding mind and a hearing (obedient heart). Understanding is really important in administer justice as the King and representatives of God. I as a Christian represent the Lord Jesus and need understanding to obey the words of God. Unless God opens my mind, I may never understand many things that I have been taught. Since my mind needs to be renewed by the word of God, it becomes easier when I pray for God to give me an understanding mind and an obedient heart.

item.title: LUK 24
item.description: LUK 24:45 Solomon prayed for an understanding mind and a hearing (obedient heart). Understanding is really important in administer justice as the King and representatives of God. I as a Christian represent the Lord Jesus and need understanding to obey the words of God. Unless God opens my mind, I may never understand many things that I have been taught. Since my mind needs to be renewed by the word of God, it becomes easier when I pray for God to give me an understanding mind and an obedient heart.

item.title: PSA 32
item.description: PSA 32:9 Solomon prayed for an understanding mind and a hearing (obedient heart). Understanding is really important in administer justice as the King and representatives of God. I as a Christian represent the Lord Jesus and need understanding to obey the words of God. Unless God opens my mind, I may never understand many things that I have been taught. Since my mind needs to be renewed by the word of God, it becomes easier when I pray for God to give me an understanding mind and an obedient heart.

item.title: 1KI 2
item.description: 1KI 2:35 A change in organisation and execution of those who committed treason in the past reign of David brought peace to the reign of Solomon. Solomon merely obeyed his father Related verses: 1 Kings 2:35. See notes 1KI 2:32 The horns of the altar is of no use protecting a criminal when he has been found out as guilty. Related verses: 1 Kings 2:32. See notes 1KI 2:27 Gods prophecy to Eli came to total fulfilment after he dismissed Abiathar.

item.title: 1CH 29
item.description: 1CH 29:23 The throne Solomon sat on was God’s throne. he was just an earthly representative of the heavenly King. He prospered a d was obeyed by his subjects Related verses: 1 Chronicles 29:23. See notes 1CH 29:19 I need a perfect heart to keep God’s commandments but I can also ask God for a perfect heart Related verses: 1 Chronicles 29:19. See notes 1CH 29:3 David gave from his personal treasure (his money) because he delighted in the house of his God.

item.title: PSA 81
item.description: PSA 81:12 Stubborness stems from the heart. it is deep rooted and very difficult to remove Related verses: Psalms 81:12. See notes PSA 81:14 God yearns and longs to help us if only we walk in his ways. He has no obligation to help us if we don’t because we have free will. Taking away that free will and controlling us is witchcraft. He is not a witch. He wants to do the job himself.

item.title: PSA 80
item.description: PSA 80:1 If my Heavenly Father is the shepherd of Israel. By default I?m also a shepherd Related verses: Psalms 80:1. See notes

item.title: PSA 79
item.description: PSA 79:8 Our sins affect future generations up till the 4th generation Related verses: Psalms 79:8. See notes PSA 79:13 We are the sheep of God?s pasture. Dwelling in the earth he created and the land he?s promised that we will inherit Related verses: Psalms 79:13. See notes PSA 79:5 God is very jealous and does not tolerate divided allegiance. I must be careful to live only for God Related verses: Psalms 79:5.

item.title: PSA 78
item.description: PSA 78:51 Egypt (Mizraim) was descended from Ham. the first born I’d the first and best. God destroyed their first and best and spared the first and best of the Israelites Related verses: Psalms 78:51. See notes PSA 78:25 Jesus is the manna that came from heaven. Jesus is the reason through whom the angels exist and are kept alive. The bread in the Holy place also signified Jesus as sustainer.

item.title: PSA 77
item.description: PSA 77:2 Prayer in the night. Desperate seeking of God and he answered Related verses: Psalms 77:2. See notes

item.title: PSA 75
item.description: PSA 75:7 God decides whom he elevates and who he brings low. The key is humility and bring teachable Related verses: Psalms 75:7. See notes PSA 75:2 God seems to judge in seasons. He picks an appointed time to execute judgements Related verses: Psalms 75:2. See notes PSA 75:1 Wondrous work is a sign of God’s presence. Related verses: Psalms 75:1. See notes PSA 75:1 Wondrous work is a sign of God’s presence.

item.title: PSA 73
